datasetStructure: One record per related record, group of records or dataset

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.STUDYID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66734

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.RDOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s)
datasetVariables.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: RDOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.IDVAR

datasetVariables.description: Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples include --SEQ and --GRPID.
datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable
datasetVariables.name: IDVAR

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.IDVARVAL

datasetVariables.description: Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR. If --SEQ is the variable being used to describe this record, then the value of --SEQ would be entered here.
datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable Value
datasetVariables.name: IDVARVAL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.RELTYPE

datasetVariables.description: Identifies the hierarchical level of the records in the relationship. Values should be either ONE or MANY. Used only when identifying a relationship between datasets (as described in Section 8.3).
datasetVariables.label: Relationship Type
datasetVariables.name: RELTYPE

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.RELID

datasetVariables.description: Unique value within USUBJID that identifies the relationship. All records for the same USUBJID that have the same RELID are considered "related/associated." RELID can be any value the sponsor chooses, and is only meaningful within the RELREC dataset to identify the related/associated Domain records.
datasetVariables.label: Relationship Identifier
datasetVariables.name: RELID

description: A dataset used to describe relationships between records for a subject within or across domains, and relationships of records across datasets. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C147182, 2018-06-29)
label: Related Records
name: RELREC
